intro: Ipomoea costellata var. edwardsensis, commonly known as Edwards' morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a herbaceous perennial that produces striking, trumpet-shaped flowers in shades of blue, violet, and white. The leaves are typically heart-shaped with a waxy texture and may have a faintly veined appearance. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight. This species is often found in wetlands, stream banks, and other moist habitats.
